runs.comm: pitches it up first ball and Warner clips it just wide of square leg
back of a length just outside off stump, Haddin stands and pokes at it but ends up pushing it back down the track to Franklin
uses his feet to Franklin this time, exposing the stumps, but the bowler drops it short and Haddin carves it behind point, Warner pushes him for the second and gets it
pitches back of a length outside leg stump, tapped to midwicket
gets some room outside off stump, crashes it straight to cover
drops this one short, but Warner gets over the bounce and gets the wrists into play, turning the ball from outside off stump into the gap at midwicket and calling hard
thumped! Haddin greets the bowler by making room and hitting the ball off a length inside out over extra cover for four first ball
pitches on the stumps and he skips down, clipping to midwicket
pitches on the half-volley and swings away, Haddin again exposes the stumps and has a big swing but cannot get bat on that one, so its another dot ball to Southee
attempted yorker swings down leg stump and Haddin clips it on the full just wide of square leg, runs hard and gets three for his efforts
pitches on a length outside off stump with a hint of wobble off the seam, Warner dances down and has an almighty swipe but cannot connect at all
half-volley on the pads, flicked just wide of midwicket for one
starts off short outside leg stump and Warner flicks it past square leg
short outside off stump this time and Warner gives it a hard crack off the back foot, but Broom dives across to his left in the covers and takes some pace of that monster hit
attempted yorker ends up a low full toss and Haddin just slaps that back past Warner and the stumps, off the middle of the bat, and stands and admires his shot
another good hit, this one off the front foot as O'Brien pitches on a length outside off stump, its hit in the air well wide of mid-off, who dives and cuts it off
stand and deliver from Warner, collecting the ball on the half-volley and muscling it out of the screws, Haddin jump ups and allows the ball pass and mid-off has no chance
short of a length and he hits it off the back foot into the covers
swing and a miss, Warner flashing at the full and wide one
wrong place to bowl, son, thats pitched up and hammered on the rise past mid-off again, the best way to punish the half-volley
better delivery, pitching on middle and off and swinging back in, but Warner gets over it and punches it back past the stumps, calling for the single immediately

taken this time, and what a ball to get a wicket! Southee sends down a full toss, Haddin walks into the shot and hits the ball back over the bowler, who cups it up in the air and then takes it on the second attempt, to his right .. Haddin can't believe he's bunted a full toss back to Southee
short of a length outside off stump, defended off the back foot to point
short again, this time forced off the back foot, again straight to point
bang, thats four! O'Brien pitches short of a length outside off stump and looks on in pain as the ball rockets between midwicket and mid-off, Warner pulled that in a flash
short and swinging away, Warner flashes and cannot connect
again back of a length outside off stump, and Warner can only thump it to mid-off's lap, its the captain himself who pouches it in his lap
back of a length on middle and leg, David shuffles and turns it fine
pitched up a tad more outside off stump, Ferguson swings and misses
up and over mid-off this time, O'Brien pitches on the half-volley and Ferguson scoops it over the in field, its in the air for a while but lands safely in the deep
good ball, 135ks, short of a length outside off stump and then getting some good lift off the track, forcing David to shoulder arms and McCullum is surprised by the extra bounce
brings him forward this time, pushing the ball to short cover
good stuff again from Southee, pitching on a good length at 137ks, achieving a bit of gentle wobble off the seam to beat the bat as David pokes at it tamely

big shout from Southee this time, pitching on a length just outside off stump and getting movement and bounce again, the ball clips David's pads as he shuffles and tries to turn the ball away, its hit marginally over the knee roll, Ferguson calls his partner across for the leg bye
short and wide and Ferguson slaps that behind point for four
hits a length and thats an ugly heave across the line to midwicket
short of a length outside off stump, forced off the back foot to cover
bouncer outside off stump, no shot offered, wide called for height
dragged in short outside off stump, Ferguson pulls just over midwicket
change of pace from Butler, pitching back of a length outside off stump, the ball stays low and beats the bat as David pushes away from the body
too straight and David hops up, shuffling, and turns it around the corner
pitches it up on off stump, David pushes and inside-edges past square leg
timber! Butler pitches it up on the stumps, very full and into the block hole, Ferguson walks away and swings, no contact made, and the base of the stumps is shattered
short and wide and cut backward of point for a quick single
well tossed up, with some spin, Voges pushes an inside edge to midwicket
tosses it up, drops shorter, spins away, Voges cuts to cover and sprints
drops on a length again and this one is forced into the off side for one
well bowled, tossed up on a length, some good drift, Voges chips it off the front foot, spooning it just over extra cover and comes back for the second, well run too
short again, but he's cramped and chops the cut just wide of point
pitches down leg stump, Voges can't connect and thats a wide
short of a length outside off stump and steered wide of backward point
much fuller, just outside off stump, David shuffles and clips to midwicket
full down leg stump and flicked in the air over square leg
pitched up on a length outside off, 136ks, no shot offered
attempted yorker just on off stump, David opens the face and runs it fine
short and wide, turning a hint, David cuts and misses by a shave
tossed up just outside off, back of a length, David drives it back
pitches fractionally shorter, no turn and this one is pushed past cover
teasing length, middle and leg, David flicks straight to midwicket
slows the pace, flights it up on a length, driven in the air to extra cover
much fuller, drifting on leg stump, David onto the front foot, flicking it wide
very full again, searching for the yorker, flicked from off stump for one
well done, Butler, another accurate yorker which is dug back out
thats got a bit too much movement on it, its the attempted yorker but its swinging down leg stump and Voges just heaves it wide of backward square leg for four
this one pitches on the half-volley and Voges drives hard, back past mid-on
136ks, still searching for the blockhole, turned toward mid-on
good delivery to end the over, Butler pitches it up very full just outside off stump and David opens the face, steering a single to backward point

quicker, flatter, pitching just back of a length, its the arm ball which the batsman cannot connect on as he goes back to cut, the ball misses off stump by a shave, McCullum flicks off the off bail and appeals, not sure for what though
tossed up on the stumps and he flicks that wide of midwicket
just back of a length outside off stump, cut away square on the off side
flights it up on middle and off, he comes forward and flicks to midwicket
well done, tossed up on a length, the ball turns away from middle and off and draws a leading edge that flies safely into the covers and the batsmen pinch a single
flights it on off stump, Voges waits and pushes it into the off side
well bowled, right up there on off stump, almost a yorker, bunted back
again full and Voges squeezes it into the gap between cover and point
very accurate, full and straight, David tries to shuffle across and clip a single into the on side but cannot time it and O'Brien does the fielding
once more he slips in the full ball, very straight, David plays that shuffled flick again and doesn't time it well, but its back down the track past a diving O'Brien
better improvisation from Australia, as Voges skips down and converts the ball into a low full toss, and clips it in the air over midwicket to get a boundary
short of a length just outside off stump, chopped down to Southee at third man
tossed up on a length, Voges turns it to midwicket
fired in full this time and David gets an inside edge to square leg
short and wide and cut into the gap in front of point for a single
fired in outside off stump, slapped into the off side for one more
skips down, McCullum sees him and fires it in, Voges taps it back
full and flat on the stumps and he flicks it out to Southee for a single
full and wide, Voges reaches out, splices the ball to O'Brien on the off
full and wide, searching for the yorker, David scoops it off the toe end of the bat over extra cover, Nathan runs across in the deep, dives, fumbles, and Australia get two
superb shot! Thats a low full toss on leg stump and it sails over deep fine leg for six, that was hit off the middle ... in New Zealand, you'd say that was "sucks off the pids!"
fired in full into the blockhole and he jams the ball toward extra covert
gets across his stumps and tries to paddle an overpitched delivery, but doesn't manage to get bat on ball and so Elliott traps Voges in front of about leg stump
slower ball, looped up on the stumps, clipped to mid-on for a single
gently on leg stump, up goes the back leg as he clips to midwicket
fuller, flatter, straighter, and he miscues it back to the bowler
tossed up just outside off stump and he drives into the covers
flighted down the pads, gets a fine tickle and beats square leg
full on leg stump, another easy single into the leg side
fired into the stumps, David makes room and carves it past extra cover
full just on off stump, White makes room and drives into the off side
swipes a length ball from outside off stump to the man at midwicket
slower ball ends up a low full toss, David backs away and hits past point
well bowled Butler, another yorker-length delivery outside off stump, and only a single, squeezed into the off side
shuffles in his crease, Butler sends down a low full toss, hit to extra cover

thats massive! White, hooked up with the microphone, was just telling the on-air commentators he was lining up for a big shot, and then Butler goes and gives him a gift-wrapped full toss, which he swings rows back over midwicket for half a dozen
fired in on off stump, backs away and slices the ball past point
tosses it up on a length, slowing the pace, David sashays down and ends up chipping the ball up in the air, Broom steadies himself under it down the ground on the off side and takes it simply enough
short on off stump, not much turn, White backs away and chips past cover
flighted on leg stump, Hopes goes sweeping and can't connect
gently tossed up on middle and leg, Hopes goes over Vettori's head
short and wide and cut into the covers for a single
full and wide, driven on the half-volley to Fulton, fielding on the circle
aye, he was lining up to send that out the stadium, but he swung and missed by not much, that had pitched on a length outside off stump and had he hit, it was outta here

top edge, but where's it going? O'Brien hits a fuller length, White swings and sends the top edge spiralling up and over short third man, Broom and Brendon McCullum run after the ball but it drops near the ropes

up, up, up ... and ... into orbit ... it going, going, and ... oh well held Vettori! White heaves at another length ball on the stumps, sending it miles up into the evening sky, looks to be lost up there but the captain settles under it and takes a great catch just inside the ropes at deep midwicket
full and wide and slashed off the toe end down to third man
finishes with a yorker, on middle and leg, inside-edged to square leg

swings at a waist high full toss, gets a faint clip, McCullum dives superbly, injured shoulder and all, and intercepts the top edge brilliantly, then flicks the ball back to Southee, who runs out Henriques for 1 on his Australia debut
full down leg stump, inside-edge to square leg, they scamper one
full in the zone again, he swings and gets a faint edge, safely fine
another full toss, swung over square leg, Elliott does the fielding
makes room, goes down on one knee and scoops the wide half-volley out to the sweeper at deep extra cover
slower ball on a length, Hopes gets under it and swings over mid-on
good way to end the innings, Southee sends down a low full toss and Hopes connects well, swinging the ball over midwicket and the sweeper cannot get there in time
